revised_title: Quantum Field Theory of Optical Birefringence Phenomena: Linear and Nonlinear Optical Rotation
tldr: The authors present a general approach to discuss optical birefringence phenomena using quantum field theory and the Stokes operator description of polarization. They calculate the linear and nonlinear contributions to the angle of rotation of a plane-polarized photon beam by a solution of optically active molecules and demonstrate that nonlinear processes can lead to an intensity-dependent contribution to the optical rotation angle.
